‎04-23-2012 05:37 PM

So much bitterness.

 

I was researching the words diabetic and advocare.  I simply asked a question so back off on the barking !

I know several people that are taking TOO MANY MEDS for a number of reasons.  The older we get the more we seem to have to take (according to our doctors).

I know people that have benefitted from advocare products and I am not saying that everyone will.

 

But if you take an ignorant stance and rip on it because you have heard from one or two or five people that didn't like it, you probably learn that they are negtive about many things in life.

 

My kid's school has 5 teachers that have lost anywhere from 20-70 lbs.  I am slim, but I am benefitting from the energy it provides.

Again, if you read my question... Has anyone tried ADVOCARE?  It was simply a question and if you are happy taking 1, 2, 5 or 10 different medications every day...well good for you but there is probably a better alternative measure whether you decide to try a nutrional product or medicinal or whatever.  


But don't hate just because.  Open up to listening instead of bashing.

Report Inappropriate Content

Re: Has anyone tried ADVOCARE?

 

04-23-2012 08:58 AM

I am curious to see what you are spending for all of your prescriptions already.

What have you done to bring your weight down?  I have had several friends/family have great results with the advocare products in combination with exercise and there depression and diabetes conditions have improved.

 
 

 

Re: Has anyone tried ADVOCARE?

 

04-23-2012 09:01 AM

Continue a healthy diet and stick with the products.  The products help change your body's inner molecular structure and train it to be and expect a healthier lifestyle and diet.

 

This to me sounds like a sales pitch. So pardon us for not trusting you. We have heard it all before!!


James G

I'm just a guy who has had type 2 diabetes for 30+ years.

"It is common sense to take a method and try it. If it fails, admit it frankly and try another. But above all, try something." – Franklin D. Roosevelt
"When you get to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on." – Franklin D. Roosevelt
"Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us everyday." - Sally Koch
"I always wondered why somebody doesn't do something about that. Then I realized I was somebody." – Lily Tomlin
"Worrying does not empty tomorrow of its troubles.. it empties today of its strength." - Corrie Ten Boom
"Happiness is a state of mind." - Walt Disney

On 9/5/14 had amputation of my right leg, below the knee.

Latest A1C 6.0 on 8/10/15
Lipids test on 4/16/15
Total Cholesterol 133
HDL Cholesterol 45
LDL Cholesterol 69.8
Triglycerides 91

Diabetes Medications
500mg Metformin twice a day
20 units Levemir, 10 in the morning and 10 at night

‎04-23-2012 07:23 PM

strongforlife wrote:

Continue a healthy diet and stick with the products.  The products help change your body's inner molecular structure and train it to be and expect a healtheir lifestyle and diet.

What! How gullible do you think we are?

 

Do you wonder that our antennae go up when we read a statement like that?

 

If you are not selling and simply buying a product because you believe that statement about changing molecular structure, why not stay here with us for a while.

 

You will find out that most of us are quite active and healthy and have good control of our blood glucose.

 We do it with a good diet that is lower in carbs that we used to eat, exercise when possible, and meds when necessary.

 

I have lots of energy but not a lot of money to waste on supplements and meal replacements. I would never dream of doing a 10 day body cleanse outside of a bona fide medical facility. I doubt that any of my medical team would recommend that- our bodies take care of themselves as far as eliminating toxins and waste.

 

Dianne

Dianne

Diagnosed as type 2 in 2005 with an A1c of 9.1

Started with metformin and a low dose of an ARB for blood pressure. Added a sulfonylurea (a med that helps my pancreas produce my own insulin) Also a low dose of Crestor to lower my cholesterol.
After 7 years I could no longer tolerate metformin so am doing my best to keep control with a max dose of the sulfonylurea and lots of walking, some swimming.

"Molly" (aka mollythed)
